context: [10] Similarly, VOCs shifted the half-maximal voltage of steady-state inactivation (V1/2, inact) from approximately â€“16 mV in control to â€“32, â€“35, and â€“20 mV in the presence of TOL, TCE, and PERC, respectively. [11] Inhibition of ICa by TOL was confirmed in primary cultures of cortical neurons, where 827 Î¼M TOL inhibited current by 61%. [12] These data demonstrate that VOCs perturb voltage-sensitive Ca2+ channel function in neurons, an effect that could contribute to the acute neurotoxicity of these compounds. [1] Volatile organic compounds (VOCs), such as toluene (TOL), 1,1,1-trichloroethylene (TCE), and 1,1,2,2-tetrachloroethylene (perchloroethylene; PERC), are widely used as paint-thinners, industrial degreasing agents, and dry-cleaning agents. [2] Acute exposure to sufficient concentrations of these compounds results in behavioral and neurological deficits, characterized by biphasic changes in locomotor activity , psychomotor impairment , incoordination, sedation , and alterations in cognitive ability (; ). [3] The mechanism(s) underlying the acute effects of these and other VOCs is not well understood and generally has received little attention. [1] VOCs share many effects with CNS depressant compounds, such as ethanol, barbiturates, benzodiazepines, and volatile anesthetics (for review, see ).
